output_list.code: function transferFrom(address _from, address _to, uint256 _value) public returns (bool success) { require(_value <= allowance[_from][msg.sender]);     allowance[_from][msg.sender] -= _value; _transfer(_from, _to, _value); return true; }
output_list.reason: The transferFrom function does not check if the allowance of the sender for the recipient is sufficient to transfer the specified amount. This could lead to an integer overflow if the allowance is greater than the maximum safe integer value (2^256 - 1).

output_list.code: function mintToken(address target, uint256 mintedAmount) onlyOwner public { balanceOf[target] += mintedAmount; totalSupply += mintedAmount; Transfer(0, owner, mintedAmount); Transfer(owner, target, mintedAmount); }
